poll_list.title: One Month Budget Extension for Strategic Happiness Core Unit - October 31, 2022

discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] The SHCU Requests a moment of your time \xf0\x9f\xa5\xb0

content.content: [Signal Request] The SHCU Requests a One-Month Budget Extension   Are Signal Requests still a thing these days? I don’t think the latest polls have concluded yet, so I assume they are… but this may be one of our last!     Overview Due to reasons:  The SHCU is requesting a one-time distribution for a one-month budget extension.  SHCU Annual Budget:  770,000 DAI [Current] 62.5 MKR   Monthly Pro-Rated Stream:  64,167 DAI [Current] 5.21 MKR   Signal Request Limitations:  50,000 DAI [Arbitrary]   Requested Amount for this SR:   49,999.99 DAI [Adjusted For Arbitrary Constraints] 5.21 MKR        Farewell? My time is up on Monday. I know it’s my time to go. I’ve made peace with that… but deep down, I just don’t want to let go just yet.   DevCon DevCon was great. I got to see so many faces again. Share our merch with the LATAM community, our team, and all the other attendees that flew in from across the world for this event. Sure, maybe I didn’t have a swag truck like AAVE did. It’s hard to knock on them for that… but truthfully? I’m not sure how many people I saw showing off their AAVE swag.  Ours though?    The looks on everyone’s faces when they’d get their hands on one of our (throwback) hats or fannies, or cinch bags. That alone was priceless  These people love Maker. They love DAI… and the little bit of merch they received? It means the world to them. You can just see it in their eyes. Each item is something they’ll treasure for life. They’ll proudly show it off to all their friends for years to come. You can’t put a price tag on that. Somehow I managed to get 15 duffel bags through customs!  Did anyone know you can check 15 bags?  Turns out, you can check as many as you want! lol And since they were “regalos”… $300 (and 3.5 hours of my time) was enough to keep our friends at customs satisfied. As counterintuitive as it may sound, it’s cheaper than shipping. You’re also guaranteed that it will arrive when you arrive.      The Request So, back to my SR… Our event next in Barcelona is around the corner, ETH-Gathering. Everyone from our team is going. (I’ve even heard rumors that the legend himself may or may not be there!) I hope the DAO does not mind that taken the liberty to pre-funded a portion of the arrangements for this event from my budget. Of course, not in its entirety. If I’m to go purely by the rule of “code is law” or whatever, I have no obligation to fulfill any more requests beyond Monday… but, alas, that’s not me. Whether or not I’ll be running on fumes, whether or not I get paid, I’ve made promises, set expectations, and I intend to follow through on them. It wouldn’t be my first nor my last time I work for no pay. Something about being passionate about the project or something? Beats me lol It took a while for people in our community to ask for compensation or salary at all in the first place! Anyway, there’s a few cool things I’d like to deliver for this event (and one in Lisbon happening in a few days). This little budget extension will let me deliver on one of my final Happiness Drops for our community. (I invite all to attend!)  Don’t Be Shy! The drop ship to everyone that gave me their addresses a little while back should be shipping out this week. I have approximately 40-60 addresses logged to send out to 200250 recipients. That one was primarily geared towards domestic recipients to avoid customs issues. Anyone abroad that will also be in Barcelona, shoot me a DM with any special requests, and I’ll do my best to get it to you in Europe!    Poll Details  Transfers  49,999.99 DAI will be transferred to:   StrategicHappiness.eth: SHCU Operational Wallet   The SHCU Golden Parachute:  Distribution will be delayed by 31 days. No additional DAI is requested. An additional 5.21 MKR will be added to the severance package.  This sum represents the pro-rated vest over an additional month and is based on previously approved terms outlined in the SHCU’s onboarding MIPS.   The address for Golden Parachute distribution will remain TBD.    No matter how this SR goes, the SHCU will still be officially offboarded as per the Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3), assuming 100k+ MKR doesn’t magically show up to overturn the current breakdown. However, if this poll passes, the SHCU will continue to exist in spirit and be funded for one more month, after which I, your Shitpost Facilitator, will step down, relinquish my role as a Mandated Actor, and return to my former role as “Maker Community Member.”     Extend The SHCU’s Existence by One Month?   Yes: Transfer 49,999.99 DAI to the SHCU operational wallet and add one month of pro-rated MKR (5.21) vest to the SHCU Golden Parachute.  No: Stop flipping votes and leave already. Abstain      0 voters     This poll will run until October 28th. 2022-10-22T04:00:00Z→2022-10-28T15:11:00Z If successful, an on-chain vote will be held to confirm the changes.  Next Steps  I make some dope swag for ya’ll      Edit From some of the comments and messages re this SR, it seems that some of those among us are worried about formatting and technicalities. Why an SR? Not an SPF? What was he thinking? Also, didn’t he realize that throwing in that MKR would throw off everything? This SR can’t possibly go to vote like this! Unfortunately, the five-minute window for changes passes by a lot faster than anyone could fathom. Anyway, if I take this SR down, that spoils all the fun! We should test our system’s resiliency, no? If the 5.21 MKR is some kind of deal breaker, send it to this address instead:  0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is requesting a one-month budget extension for the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SHCU) and is explaining the details of the request. The post also includes information about the author's experience at DevCon and their plans to deliver a "Happiness Drop" for the community. The post ends with a poll for the community to vote on whether to extend the SHCU's existence by one month. Some commenters have expressed concerns about the formatting and technicalities of the proposal.

content.content: An SPF fixes (?) this.

To clarify GovAlpha’s position on this SR:     juan:  An SPF fixes (?) this.    An SPF would not be appropriate as SPFs can only include DAI amounts, and the author is requesting a transfer of MKR. We will allow this funding request given the extraordinary circumstance where funds have been pre-paid for the event in question. Passage of this Signal Request will not prolong the Facilitator or Mandated Actor status of Burban, which will be removed upon ratification of the offboarding proposal. We will not permit further ad hoc funding requests for this Core Unit/individual unless they go through an established MIP process.  Voters should consider these points when casting their votes.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Where is the Dai going and how is it being managed? The SR states MakerDAO will transfers funds to the operational wallet and Aburban will no longer have access to that. Also, surely the vested MKR hasn’t been prepaid?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party asking questions about proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: CodeKnight:  The SR states MakerDAO will transfers funds to the operational wallet and Aburban will no longer have access to that.   Why wouldn’t he still have access to the operational wallet? The listed address is an EOA. @aburban90 will need to comment on the specifics of his wallet setup, but I can’t see any technical reason why he wouldn’t be able to access the funds.     CodeKnight:  Also, surely the vested MKR hasn’t been prepaid?   I’m unsure what you mean by this question or if it’s directed to me or someone else. AFAIK this Core Unit has received no MKR to date.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Oh, I had assumed the operational wallets were controlled by MakerDAO. If they are controlled by the individuals, then it is not an issue.

At the risk of veering off-topic, the setup varies by CU. We can stop streaming funds through an executive and many (but not all) CUs have the PauseProxy listed as a beneficiary so we can claw back DAI from wallets through an exec, but we cannot remove control of a multi-sig from their owners without their consent.

content.content: So I agree it’s suboptimal and I would have advised against posting the SR with these options, if asked. But, there are some mitigating factors:  We cannot change poll options once live. Over 40 people have already voted - a very good turnout for a Signal Request in recent months. At the time of posting, SH-001 was still an active CU with a specific mandate from MKR voters for “Shitposting”, so I am prepared to allow a little discretion on these grounds for this specific case, or anyone with a similar mandate.  We did discuss internally whether or not to remove this Signal Request but we decided to leave it up. It will still require on-chain consent for any payments to be included in an Executive Vote.

content.content: Patrick_J:  with a specific mandate from MKR voters for “Shitposting”   A mandate is a mandate

Gustav_Arentoft:  This is a little bit funny when everyone is praising AAVE’s swag, and has done for years. They have been known for this. They literally have a line of people outside of their booths. They brought thousands of t-shirts and all of it gone. Fun fact: AAVE’s swag budget is smaller than ours - with 2 full-time designers only doing swag.   I can’t knock AAVE. They try their best. They even had the truck… but heat-transferred vinyl merch… sure, it looks nice the first or second time you wear it. After a few washes though, the vinyl cracks apart. The design crumbles. Longevity and utility take the backseat. Hang it on your wall, stuff it in your drawer. Of course, you’ll save money cutting corners! Meanwhile, our gear lasts and lasts and lasts… Take your pick

content.content: Everyone should take notes of the delegates voting for this excessive spend in these times. Nothing against Burban, he seems like a great guy, but waste is waste. I would hope we could meet somewhere in the middle where the DAO can sponsor his trips to the upcoming 2 conferences but no additional swag. ~$40k to spend on stuff that people generally can’t wear in public without painting a target on themselves (referring to stories of robberies, of people getting airtags dropped on themselves when wearing bayc swag in even the most developed countries, etc) is too much when we are burning through our surplus buffer already. As always, my thoughts.

content.content: I couldn’t agree more with that observation, and it is a bit like reality. I have maker merch from years ago, and it is still intact, however, I have seen some lens flannels, and they have lost some of their colour. However, it will remain for all of us who went to DEVCON that AAVE broke the bank in terms of merchandise, whether it was good or bad quality. Maker Merch = Top Quality.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: lyt:  waste is waste   So, apologies in advance (or in post?)  for any bitterness in my tone as of late. Everyone seems quite concerned about trimming fat and waste in these hard times. Rightfully so, ofc! It’s pretty easy to look at $50k spend on merch and see pure waste. It’s visible (that’s the point! ). On its face, it seems to deliver no tangible benefits. There’s no particularly quantifiable ROI. (Though, I challenge any of you to assign a value to its effect on our brand image and community retention, an effect that persists years and years out). $50k is a rounding error. 5mkr is a rounding error. $1m is a rounding error. You know what’s not a rounding error? Watching 90%+ of our DAO spending their entire budgets worldwide…: on debit cards. No thought given to those little things they call “foreign transaction fees”… imagine, 3-5% gone, on every swipe, in every country. To the void, silently. Now multiply that across the entirety of our org’s spending. Is that $50k? Is that $500k? Is it an order more? Who knows… no one tracks it, but it’s not visible, so we don’t care. And before someone tries to say that we should be doing fewer offsites and traveling to bring that number down, I caution against that as well. Offsites are extremely valuable for group cohesion, communication, and developing ideas through serendipity. No, they’re not cheap… but, they are necessary. We can do some math there as well… and how much we could collectively save routing through me… but, I’ll spare it since I’m ranting at this point.  Tldr; Stop focusing on the wrong things. With love, Burban
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: aburban90:  Watching 90%+ of our DAO spending their entire budgets worldwide…: on debit cards. No thought given to those little things they call “foreign transaction fees”… imagine, 3-5% gone, on every swipe, in every country. To the void, silently. Now multiply that across the entirety of our org’s spending. Is that $50k? Is that $500k? Is it an order more? Who knows… no one tracks it, but it’s not visible, so we don’t care.   There is so much truth in this statement.  From my experience with the DAO. I would say about 10 percent of our CU spend went to Accountable and poor exchange rates/fees. If the target is wasteful spending then targeting swag spend is short sighted.  Everyone you give swag to basically becomes a walking advertisement for Maker……but who am I to argue with the wisdom of Maker governance.

content.content: PonJerry:  Accountable   Gonna have to step in and defend Accountable here a bit though. While their rates earlier on were quite high, they’ve come down to much more sensible ones over time. I forget how much my CU was paying, but iirc, annualized cost for their services including conversion fees, expense tracking, and reporting, would have come out to roughly $30-35k or so? For the freeing of cognitive bandwidth alone, that price seems more than fair to me. While I agree that centralizing all our budgets with one service provider is unwise, Accountable does take on large responsibilities for us, absorbing many of the risks of the grey area this industry is. Also, finding a way to go from DAI to fiat via any route will come at a cost. Through Accountable, through another setup, those losses are a given and ones we may have to just accept for now. Post-conversion however… how did we come to justify tacking on another 3-5%?
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: aburban90:  There’s no particularly quantifiable ROI.   There certainly can(and should) be quantifiable metrics on marketing spends.

CodeKnight:  There certainly can(and should) be quantifiable metrics on marketing spends.   You can quantify the spending of course. In my case, I’ve been regularly submitting detailed expense reports for PnL each month to Strategic Finance and SES. Admittedly, it took a while to get a working system for myself to track and report appropriately, but, once I got that sorted out, all expenses are accounted for, outlined, and submitted each month. As for quantifying ROI, I’m not entirely sure how to assign a numerical value for that. What is the $ value of a merch recipient posting their swag on social media, tagging  us, and sharing that with the internet? We can probably pick numbers out of a hat for that. There’s clearly value there, but… quantifying it? I’m a mechanical engineer, I don’t have a marketing background. I’m sure marketing firms have all sorts of mystical ways to assign values for these things to sell their services to clients. I’m sure most of their numbers are fiction anyway, (with grains of truth ofc).
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

Even eliciting just the slightest hint of a grin or chuckle… or maybe even a smile : ) …it would mean the world to me, and I hope will brighten your day as well

content.content: Because I’ve had this conversation before, just want to jump in here and say the accountable costs are huge (unless something changed recently).  Obviously, also very helpful for CU members but I wish that admin costs like this could be more visibly aggregated together so that more thought could be put into reducing them.

content.content: Traster_Tray:  accountable costs are huge   I get that my budget was one of the smallest, if not the smallest we had, but please do share what other methods and systems other teams employ that offer a substantial discount over (in my case) ~$35k/yr. Ofc, if scaled linearly, that number might be closer to $300k for a $10m budget (assuming 100% of the budget is converted to fiat). May there be some wiggle room for negotiations at that price? Maybe… but do we even have any CUs with those size budgets? In particular, ones that size that convert 100% of their budget to fiat? And since zero is off the table, what conversion rate do others consider tolerable? Edit: And of course, on top of the discounted conversation rate, the number would have to include the cost of hiring an internal accountant to fill the role of the services offered by AccountAble.

And to reiterate my comments earlier… I am VERY pro redundancy. As much as I have loved working with Accountable, and will continue to… I think it is unwise for the ENTIRE dao to rely upon a single entity… but, to vilify them?
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: Just some notes here. AAVE’s budget was significantly smaller than ours if we take the SHCU core units yearly budget, and assuming around 2 months of work was done for DevCon. Like less than half… Imo they got A LOT MORE value for their money. Cooler swag. Everyone wanting it. A lot more units. Truck. Their swag was actually really cool. Yes I remember the good old days when we had a lot of cool Maker swag with innovative quotes and catchy lines. This was before SCHU time. Printing old phrases and the logo on a variety of different overpriced items does not = to good swag imo. The friendship factor is strong and again we see the personal bias of people voting for something which is clearly irresponsible.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None

content.content: Gustav_Arentoft:  Imo they got A LOT MORE value for their money. Cooler swag. Everyone wanting it. A lot more units. Truck. Their swag was actually really cool.   Quality > quantity      aburban90:  heat-transferred vinyl merch… sure, it looks nice the first or second time you wear it. After a few washes though, the vinyl cracks apart. The design crumbles. Longevity and utility take the backseat. Hang it on your wall, stuff it in your drawer.   Of course, you’ll save money if f cutting corners is your primary objective. —— You can cut corners all day and save money galore. Regrettably, I actually bought another item for Bogota that looked super slick in photos. On arrival… I knew they’d fall apart within six months of use. Ofc, I could have gone ahead and handed them out anyway… no one would have noticed, not right away at least. The money spent was a sunk cost, but I had to make a judgment call. There is no worse look for our brand’s image than merch representing a lack of regard for care, utility, and longevity… an effect that would be noticed months later, and reflect accordingly on our image. It’s beneath my standards, and it should be a value shared across our community. It’s a judgement call AAVE’s team chooses to make, and I respect their decision, but it’s not one I would feel comfortable with for myself, nor for our brand.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: This SR is now closed. A majority voted in favour of this proposal. An on-chain poll will be posted today.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
